graph.original_query: Create a responsive, professional single-page CV Builder using Tailwind CSS + Flowbite via CDN (no build tools) in pure HTML/CSS/JS, with a 3-column layout:Left column: dark background, vertical menu with icons and text (sections: Personal Information, Work Experience, Education, Skills, Certifications, Templates), a progress bar at top, an “Export as PDF” button and a “Reset Form” button at bottom.Center column: shows the active form section, styled with Flowbite components (cards, inputs, select, file upload), smooth transitions, consistent spacing, and minimalist borders/shadows.Right column: live CV Preview styled like a professional resume, with section-wise entries updating in real time based on user input; optimized for print/export and styled in white background with rich black text.Maintain a modern black-and-white theme, beautiful sans-serif font (e.g. DM Sans or Inter), clear headers, icons, spacing, and button styles.Make layout mobile/tablet responsive using Tailwind utilities.Ensure PDF export, form reset, and section navigation work with minimal JS.Call CoderAgent in 8–10 detailed steps: layout skeleton, Tailwind/Flowbite setup, left nav build, section forms, live preview, JS sync logic, PDF export, responsive tweaks, print styles, polish spacing + font sizing.

T001.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to generate the initial HTML structure for the CV builder with a three-column layout using Tailwind CSS grid. This involves creating the basic HTML file with the necessary Tailwind and Flowbite CDN links and setting up the grid structure with placeholders for the left navigation, central form sections, and right-side live preview. The structure should be responsive and adapt well to different screen sizes using Tailwind's responsive utilities. I will use direct file creation for this task.

T002.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to update the existing `index.html` file by adding meta viewport tag, basic CSS resets and also including CDN links for Tailwind CSS and Flowbite.  I'll modify the file content directly by inserting the necessary tags and styles into the `<head>` section, as well as add a simple CSS reset at the top of the `<style>` tag. This should enhance the responsiveness and ensure a consistent baseline style for the CV builder. I will use direct file creation for this task.

T003.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to create the left vertical navigation menu within the existing `index.html` file. I will use Tailwind CSS classes for styling. The menu should be fixed to the left side of the screen and include a progress bar at the top, icons and text for the specified sections, and 'Export as PDF' and 'Reset Form' buttons at the bottom. I'll read the content of the existing `index.html` file, modify the `<aside>` tag content with the navigation menu and progress bar and buttons, and then write back the updated content to the same file. I'll use direct file creation for this task.

I will read the existing `index.html` file, insert the form elements within the `<main>` tag, ensuring smooth transitions, consistent spacing, and minimalist styling. I'll use input fields for name, address, phone number, email, and a file upload for the profile picture. I'll use direct file creation for this task.

nodes.agent_prompt: Generate the initial HTML structure for the CV builder with a three-column layout using Tailwind CSS grid. Include placeholders for the left navigation, central form sections, and right-side live preview. Make sure the structure is responsive and adapts well to different screen sizes.

The structure should be responsive and adapt well to different screen sizes using Tailwind's responsive utilities. I will use direct file creation for this task.

nodes.description: Implement the Work Experience form section using Flowbite components, allowing users to add multiple work experiences with fields for job title, company, duration, and description.
nodes.agent_prompt: Implement the 'Work Experience' form section in the center column using Flowbite components. Allow users to add multiple work experiences with fields for job title, company, duration, and description. Ensure the styling is consistent with the other form sections.

nodes.description: Implement the Education, Skills, and Certifications form sections using Flowbite components.
nodes.agent_prompt: Implement the 'Education', 'Skills', and 'Certifications' form sections in the center column using Flowbite components. The 'Education' section should allow users to add multiple education entries with fields for degree, university, and duration. The 'Skills' section should include a list of skills with proficiency levels. The 'Certifications' section should allow users to add multiple certifications with fields for name, issuing organization, and date obtained. Ensure the styling is consistent with the other form sections.

nodes.description: Build the live CV preview in the right column, styled like a professional resume with section-wise entries updating in real time based on user input.
nodes.agent_prompt: Create the live CV preview in the right column, styled like a professional resume. The preview should dynamically update section-wise in real time based on user input from the form sections. Style the preview with a white background, rich black text, clear headers, and a beautiful sans-serif font (e.g., DM Sans or Inter).

nodes.description: Implement the JavaScript logic to synchronize form inputs with the live CV preview in real-time.
nodes.agent_prompt: Write the JavaScript code to synchronize the form inputs in the center column with the live CV preview in the right column in real-time. Use event listeners to capture input changes and update the corresponding elements in the preview section. Include logic for adding and removing work experience and education entries.

nodes.description: Implement the PDF export functionality using a JavaScript library or method to convert the CV preview to a PDF file.
nodes.agent_prompt: Implement the 'Export as PDF' functionality. Use a JavaScript library (e.g., jsPDF) or method to convert the CV preview in the right column to a PDF file when the user clicks the 'Export as PDF' button. Ensure the PDF output is styled correctly and optimized for printing.

nodes.description: Implement the form reset functionality using JavaScript to clear all input fields in the form sections.
nodes.agent_prompt: Write the JavaScript code for the 'Reset Form' button. When clicked, it should clear all input fields in the form sections and reset the live CV preview to its initial state.

nodes.description: Optimize the layout for mobile and tablet responsiveness using Tailwind CSS utilities.
nodes.agent_prompt: Optimize the CV builder layout for mobile and tablet devices using Tailwind CSS responsive utilities (e.g., `sm:`, `md:`, `lg:` prefixes). Ensure the three-column layout adapts well to smaller screens, the navigation menu collapses into a hamburger menu on mobile, and the form sections and live preview remain readable and functional.

nodes.description: Add print styles to optimize the CV preview for printing and PDF export.
nodes.agent_prompt: Add specific print styles to the CV preview to ensure it is optimized for printing and PDF export. This includes setting a white background, rich black text, removing unnecessary elements, and adjusting margins and padding for a clean and professional print layout.

nodes.description: Polish the CV builder by adjusting spacing, font sizing, and button styles for a consistent and professional look and feel.
nodes.agent_prompt: Fine-tune the CV builder's styling by adjusting spacing, font sizing, and button styles. Ensure consistent spacing between elements, readable font sizes, and professional-looking button styles using Tailwind CSS classes. Focus on a modern black-and-white theme with a beautiful sans-serif font (e.g., DM Sans or Inter).

nodes.description: Summarize the job. What does the cv builder allow and what are the techincal specifications.
nodes.agent_prompt: Summarize the functionalities of the created CV builder. Also list out the techinal specification of the builder, like the libraries and frameworks used and the version of them. Also list out important functions that the builder performs.
